result.execSummary:
The defendant Amari A Gutierrez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and school.
Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide DNA sample. 
Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.

Work a minimum of 15 hours per week. 
Work on obtaining a high school diploma/GED/HSED.

Complete 36 hours of driver's education.
Obtain a valid driver's license.
No driving without a valid driver's license or car insurance.
Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber release for work and school, STAYED until 6-19-2023.  Court will permanently stay condition time if the defendant has a valid driver's license and high school diploma/GED/HSED by 6-19-2023.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amari A Gutierrez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amari A Gutierrez in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Amari A Gutierrez.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Charanda J. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and school.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 4 MONTHS condition time with Huber release for work and school, STAYED until 6-19-2023.  Court will permanently stay condition time if the defendant has a valid driver's license and high school diploma/GED/HSED by 6-19-2023. 
- Provide DNA sample. 
- Work a minimum of 15 hours per week. 
- Complete 50 hours of community service. 
- Complete 36 hours of driver's education.
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- No driving without a valid driver's license or car insurance. 
- Work on obtaining a high school diploma/GED/HSED. 

*Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation. 
*Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Amari A Gutierrez in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amari A Gutierrez in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amari A Gutierrez in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Jefferey Dufeer - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Amari A Gutierrez in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Amari A Gutierrez in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amari A Gutierrez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
